title: Projects
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Projects
section: The History of the War of the Ring
text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

View the tutorial for this template (+ download link)

title: Palestine
text:
I have been actively enganged in Palestine solidarity work since 2011 when I first joined the International Solidarity Movement (ISM) as an activist in Palestine. Between 2011 and 2018, I have spent approximately two years living on the West Bank, mostly in Hebron but also in Bethlehem and Jerusalem. During my many stays in the Occupied Palestinian Territories, I have witnessed immense injustice and brutality from Israeli settlers and solidiers alike. From Palestine and at home in Denmark, I have continously written about what I have seen in Palestine, appeard in various media outlets, and spoken at schools and various organizations.
Below, I have gathered some of my writings and media appearances, most of which is in Danish. The rest of this pages will be in Danish.

title: Palestine
text:
Foredrag
Siden jeg først begyndte at tage til de besatte områder i Palæstina, har jeg holdt foredrag om mine oplevelser. Det er blevet til over 50 foredrag på højskoler, efterskoler, gymnasier og i diverse foreninger. Mit foredrag fortæller en personlig historie om at vokse op med Israel/Palæstina-konflikten tæt på som dansk jøde med israelsk familie. Foredraget handler om hvordan mit syn på konflikten ændrede gennem mit møde med palæstinenserne, og hvordan jeg endte med at bruge over to år af mit liv på den Vestbredden og dokumentere livet for palæstinensere under israelsk besættelse. I foredraget fortæller jeg blandt andet om 2014, hvor jeg var i Israel og på Vestbredden mens Israel udførte sit hidtil voldsomste angre på Gaza. Gennem mine oplevelser forsøger jeg at give noget nuancer og noget kontekst til konflikten som sjældent finder plads i den offentlige samtale.
Hvis du er interesseret i, at jeg kommer og holder foredrag på din skole eller i din forening, er du velkommen til at kontakte mig på mail.
Nedenfor findes en liste over nogle af mine skriverier og medieoptrædender, der relaterer sig til Palæstina. Listen er ikke komplet og vil blive opdateret løbende.

title: Yonatan Goldshtein
text:
Facebook
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Email
  



Hi! I’m Yonatan Goldshtein. I am currently an assistant professor of Scandinavian Studies at Aalborg University. Starting July 2024 I will join the DFF project “Attitudes and Understanding in Dialect Levelling - AUDiaL” led by Nicolai Pharao as a postdoctoral researcher at University of Copenhagen. In this project, we investigate the role of the individual language users’ attitudes to language and place (among other things) in language change.
I identify as a scholar of language variation. By accident, I have also become a theoretical phonologist with a burning passion for everything that happens at the morphology-phonology interface. I am interested in exploring language variation on all scales, from large-scale quantitative studies of grammatical or attitudinal variation to the local negotiations of linguistic meaning between interlocutors in interaction. My interest in theoretical phonology has centered on the prosodic phenomenon “stød” in Danish as well as the historically related word accents found in neighboring North Germanic languages.
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.
In this time of ongoing genocide in Gaza, I support Palestinian Campaign for the Academic and Cultural Boycott of Israel as an academic but also as a Jew, as an Israeli, and as conscientious human being.
